descriptions.description: JSON-C implements a reference counting object model that allows you to easily construct JSON objects in C, output them as JSON formatted strings and parse JSON formatted strings back into the C representation of JSON objects.

set.commands:
PACKAGE_NAME=json-c PACKAGE_VERSION=0.11
oegextract ${PACKAGE_NAME}-${PACKAGE_VERSION}.tar.gz
configure --prefix=${OEG_BASE_DIR} --with-gnu-ld --enable-shared --bindir=${OEG_BASE_BIN_DIR} --libdir=${OEG_BASE_LIB_DIR} ${CONFIGURE_HOST_PARA} make #make check #fails? make install-strip DESTDIR=${OEG_INSTALL_DIR} # fails, but it seems to be everything at its place...
cd "${OEG_INSTALL_DIR}${OEG_BASE_DIR}"
mv bin bin64 # TODO: Do we need to edit the .la files in lib64?
oegarchive ${PACKAGE_NAME}-${PACKAGE_VERSION}
